se.lypson.common.gui.graphics
Class RectangularComponent

java.lang.Object
  se.lypson.common.gui.graphics.RectangularComponent
Direct Known Subclasses:
ListBox, Scrollbar, TextField
public abstract class RectangularComponent
extends java.lang.Object

This is an abstract base class for components with a rectangular shape. Classes implementing this class can be drawn on Canvas or CustomItem instances.

Author:
Tobias Persson

Creates a new instance of RectangularComponent

Parameters:
display - the Display instance to retrieve the colors from, or null to use default colors.
x - the left position of the component.
y - the top position of the component.
width - the width of the component.
height - the height of the component.

setColorsNeutral

public void setColorsNeutral(int borderColor,
                             int backgroundColor,

Sets the colors of the component to use when the component is drawn in a neutral (not highlighted) state.

Parameters:
borderColor - the neutral border color.
backgroundColor - the neutral background color.
foregroundColor - the neutral foreground color.

draw

public abstract void draw(javax.microedition.lcdui.Graphics graphics,
                          boolean highlighted)
Draws the component.

Parameters:
graphics - The Graphics instance to use to draw the component.
highlighted - true if the component should be drawn in a highlighted state; otherwise, false.
